{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31215].
  {panel}

I have reproduced this with Safari, Chrome, Dolphin, and Firefox.
The following URL will not display due to redirect loops:

https://skilamederi.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/console.action

In Firefox it displays as:

https://skilamederi.atlassian.net/login?dest-url=%2Fwiki%2Fadmin%2Fconsole.action

fields.summary: redirect loop when selecting Confluence Admin from menu

fields.description:
h3. Step to Reproduce
# Attach a image to a Confluence page
# Resize it to 300px or below.

You will see that the image quality decrease tremendously.

300px
!bad.png!

310px
!good.png!


As you can see, there is a big difference between this two image even though there is only 10px  difference is their size.

Upon inspection.

You will see that the Confluence is trying to resize a thumbnail
{code}
src="/download/thumbnails/753668/2013-10-14%2009.03.34.png?version=1&modificationDate=1381934123961&api=v2
{code}
instead of  the source
{code}
src="/download/attachments/753668/2013-10-14%2009.03.34.png?version=1&modificationDate=1381934123961&api=v2"
{code}

Somehow, if you resize it to 300px or below, the Confluence will automatically try to resize the thumbnail instead of the original attachment. The size of the thumbnail is a lot smaller than the original size therefore when the Confluence try to increase or decrease the size, the quality drop tremendously.
fields.summary: The quality of image attachment becomes bad once you resize it to 300px or below from the original size
'Share a Link' does not send email notification

fields.description:
Theres a Problem with the "Share a Link" Blueprint. 
If you share a Link, where the content could not parse correctly, a Server side error is thrown and the AJAX Request while fetching the image or creating the page aborted. 

Because the Blueprint JS doens't handle the Abort, it seems that the page creation request proceeded endless. 

To reproduce this problem, you can try to share this link: 
http://wiki.doebe.li/Beat/EinBuchZuWikis

{code}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in path at index 37: /pub/Main/SitePreferences/favicon.ico
        at java.net.URI.create(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URI.resolve(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharelinks.metaextractor.SimpleDOMMetadataExtractor.getAbsolutePath(SimpleDOMMetadataExtractor.java:104)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharelinks.metaextractor.SimpleDOMMetadataExtractor.updateMetadata(SimpleDOMMetadataExtractor.java:63)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharelinks.metaextractor.MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.parseMetaData(MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.java:68)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharelinks.SharelinksContextProvider.getContextMap(SharelinksContextProvider.java:64)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.createcontent.actions.DefaultBlueprintContentGenerator.getContentTemplateContext(DefaultBlueprintContentGe
nerator.java:207)
{code}
fields.summary: Share Link - Endless loading & Internal Server Error

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31205]. {panel} Problem: If a user deletes a page in a space that is the space homepage the following breaks: * Clicking on the space homepage logo in the sidebar does nothing * The navigation in the bottom left of the sidebar doesn't work We don't want users to shoot themselves in the foot, what we propose is to not allow a user to delete a page if it is set as the homepage. If they go to Tools > Delete and that is the homepage, instead of displaying a confirmation prompt we display: "Oops, it looks like this page is set as your Space Homepage. You will need to
fields.summary: Don't allow a user to delete a space homepage without pointing them to set a new one
Healthcheck plugin should try to enable critical plugins that are disabled

fields.description:
Many renderers in the Widget Connector are just using url.contains(MATCH_URL) to invoke the rendering service which is allowing "Web Site's Widget URL" parameters such as javascript:document.write(document.cookie);//#docs.google.com.

Although the attempted XSS is not executed, the velocityRenderService is being called despite the invalid URL parameter.

The parameter should go through WidgetConnectorUtil.isURLMatch(url, MATCH_URL) before it gets matched.

To reproduce:
enter using the standard macro markup language as follows:
{widget:url= javascript:document.write(document.cookie);//#docs.google.com}
Notice widget renders despite invalid url
fields.summary: Mulitple Widget Connector renderers do not check URL before they are matched
Support Internet Explorer 11 (ie11)

fields.description:
Jira issues macro version 5.1.x doesn't work properly when you link Confluence 5.3 with Jira 4.4 version. 

h4.What's Working?

If you try to *Create a New Issue* it will work properly and you will be able to see the Jira issues within your Confluence page.

h4.What's not Working?

# *Search* feature isn't working. When you tip a search method in the field, the issues will display properly. However, when you click on *Insert* nothing happens and the dialog is still displayed.
# *Recently Viewed* option just display an 400 HTTP error:
!issue.png!

h4.Steps to Reproduce: 

*On JIRA side*

# Install Jira 4.4 version
# Create an issue in JIRA

*On Confluence side*

# Install Confluence 5.3 version with Jira macros 5.1.x version
# Create an Application Link between both instances
# Edit/create a page
# Go to Insert > Jira Issues
# Click on Search and tip any issue key, search URL, JIRA link, JQL or plain text in order to display the issue(s)
# Click on Insert and the same symptom will happen
# Then, click on Recently viewed and the second symptom is displayed.
fields.summary: Jira Issues Not Working for Confluence 5.3 and Jira 4.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31192].
  {panel}

h4. The problem:
When you use JSONP to access the REST-API you can't set the access header. And therefore Confluence returns the default XML document, witch can't be read by javascript when you do cross origin requests.

h4. How to reproduce the problem:
# open the attached [^confluenceRestFail.html] file
# open the javascript console on you web browser
# see the error message because it can't interpret the "<" in the beginning of the XML document it gets back.

h4. Suggested fix:
Confluence could use the jsonp-callback= GET parameter to set the return type to JSON instead of XML. Because the jsonp-callback= parameter is pretty useless for a xml request...

h4. Why you can't  set the Accept header in javascript when using JSONP
You can't set the access header because when you use JSONP the tool of you choice creates a <script> element and sets the "src" attribute to the URL you want. And you can't set a Accept: "application/json" on a <script> element. Therefore your Accept headers looks like this: Accept: \*/\* and that in turn results in confluence returning XML.
fields.summary: The REST-API should work with javascript (JSONP)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31188]. {panel} h3.Steps to Reproduce # Change the space's Colour Scheme by navigating to {{Space Tools >> Look and Feel >> Colour Scheme}} (Select the Custom Colour Scheme) # Click Edit (under the Custom Colour Scheme) # Select another colour for the *Heading Text*, preferably red, so that you can clearly see the issue # Hit *Save* # Create a new page in the space # Create a Heading in the page # Press enter (you should now be in a new line under the heading) # Type "Text" # Put the cursor in front of the "Text" line and press the delete (←) button so that your "Text" line is moved up to the "Heading" and further until the "Heading" text is removed. (so that "Text" is now the new Heading) # Save the page and it will have the following storage format: {code}

Text

{code} Notice the additional rgb span tags surrounding the "Text"? h3.Observed Behavior: The new "Text" heading will have a different colour than the previous heading that is now removed. Instead of a red heading, you now get the default paragraph text's colour as the heading. h3.Expected Behavior The new "Text" heading should have the same Heading text color as per the colour scheme, and this should be the storage format instead: {code}

Text

{code} The additional span tags can break the look of the TOC macro, as the anchor link will have a different colour than the rest of the anchor links in the generated table of contents. h3.Notes Seems to occur only in Google Chrome. Firefox seems to be unaffected
fields.summary: Heading Text Colour Scheme Issue with the Confluence Editor

2. The *Share a Link* form appear. Currently, *Share with* feature only allowed to *share with users*. So, it would be good with this can be *shared with group*
fields.summary: Ability so share Blueprints with groups and emails (example: Shared Links, Decisions etc...)

fields.description:
Sometimes it is aligned properly, but sometimes the "No content found" loses the centre alignment (Cause seems to be that *{{<div class="notifications..>}}* gets a width of 0px instead of the proper width)

To reproduce:
* Have at least one 'tab' (eg Popular/Network) that will show "No content found"
* Either flip between the tabs (this flakily reproduces); or
* Open menu, and hit 'Dashboard' (this much more reliably reproduces the bug)

Seems to be a 5.0 bug - didn't see it in 4.3
fields.summary: "No content found" is sometimes not centre aligned (Android)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31181].
  {panel}

Currently we show you a "warning" message in the Editor when someone else is editing the page at the same time as you.

Over time our merging has improved a lot, and today in most circumstances this doesn't need to concern you at all.

We should change this to an 'info' message and alter the text to:

bq. This page is also being edited by [~onevalainen]. Your changes will be merged with theirs when you save.
fields.summary: New message in the Editor when others are editing the page at the same time as you.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31172].
  {panel}

Currently, the binary installers follows symbolic links when searching for "changed" content under the Confluence (or JIRA) Installation Directory.

Eg, I have all my personal images linked under the /opt/confluence/confluence/images folder - so the binary installer thinks a bunch of files has been added. 

For JIRA, a lot of customized gif's are linked in.

Worst case, ignoring this and taking a backup via the installer gives a rather big zip file.

So if the installer could either ignore or present a dialog box regarding ignoring (choosing) symlink, that would be excellent.
fields.summary: Ignore or choose how to handle symlinks in the binary installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31160].
  {panel}

Currently, Confluence leaves the username field filled in after a failed login attempt, but still places the cursor in this field. If a user is not paying attention, they risk typing their password in plain text where the user ID should go. 

Alternative solutions include:
* Not placing the cursor in either of the input fields. (Facebook's approach)
* Clearing out the username field as well. (WordPress's approach)
fields.summary: When re-entering user details after a failed login, the cursor should be placed in the password field rather than the username field

The cursor is automatically placed in the line above bullet after the word test. Down arrow keys and mouse clicks does not allow user to enter anything after the bullet.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31153].
  {panel}

The Clickable Macro is broken in Confluence 5.3 when using Chrome.  

There are two problems:
1.  Clicking on the image will bring the image to the center of the screen initially, before redirecting you to the page intended after a second or so.  Sometimes it does not redirect you at all, and you only get the zoomed in image.
2.  If you edit the macro to go directly to the page URL, you get a red X in the macro - it appears URLS do not work at all.

Steps to reproduce 1: 
1. Insert the Clickable Macro, pointing it to a space or page
2. After inserted, add an image
3. Save
4. Click on the image 
After doing this, the image will be brought to the center of the screen. After a few seconds, you may be directed to the page intended.  But I also have an example of never being redirected. 

Steps to reproduce #2:
1. Edit the macro you made before
2. Insert a direct link the page instead of the auto filled page
3. Save the macro
You'll see a red box.
fields.summary: Adaptavist Clickable Macro is broken in Chrome

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a group and user with the same name
# Create a page and attempt to restrict viewing to the group you just created via the input field:

!Screen Shot 2013-10-11 at 2.15.28 PM.png!

*Expected Results:*
The group should be shown under 'Viewing restricted to:'

*Actual Results:*
The user is added instead of the group.

*Workaround:*
Add the group via the group selection popup.
fields.summary: If a group and user have the same name, the input field on the page restrictions popup will always add the user

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a group and user with the same name.
# Create a page and restrict viewing to the user you just created.
# Attempt to also restrict the page to the group you created.

*Expected Results:*
Both the user and the group should appear under 'Viewing restricted to:'

*Actual Results:*
Only the first entity will have the restriction applied.

*Notes:*
I was also unable to add the group (if I had already added the user) via the group selection popup, and vice versa.
fields.summary: If a group and user have the same name, you can only restrict a page either the group or the user

fields.description:
h5. Symptoms

When using a JIRA Issues macro including any time tracking fields as columns, the column header is not the correct display name, for example:

* "Original Estimate" shows as "Timeoriginalestimate"
* "Σ Time Spent" shows as "Aggregatetimespent"

h5. Steps to Reproduce

* Add a JIRA Issues macro to a page in Confluence, linked to JIRA via application links
* Specify at least one column as a time tracking field
* View the macro after saving the page
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro doesn't use display name for time tracking fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31145].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Anchor links on mobile devices are not working correctly.

h3. Environment
* Confluence
* Mobile device iOs or Android, any browser 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 pages named "Page A" and "Page B"
# Page A has this content (if inserted in Wiki Markup):
{code}
h3.Subsection
h3.Subsubsection
{code}
# Page B links to Page A's Subsection and Subsubsection anchors:
{code}
[Page A#Subsubsection]







[Page A#Subsection]
{code}
# On the mobile devices click on Page A#Subsubsection

h3. Expected Results
It should take you to: Page A ,Subsubsection

h3. Actual Results
It takes you to the top of the page
 
notesh3. Notes
On the desktop browser, the redirection link is http://<hostname:port>/display/<id>/Page+A#PageA-Subsubsection
On the mobile phone browser, the redirection link is http://<hostname:port>/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=65621#content/view/65613
fields.summary: Anchor links on mobile device don't work

fields.description: When unchecking the "Watch this page" when clicking "Watch" is not remembered. Upon revisiting the page, "Watch this page" is again enabled.
fields.summary: Unchecking "Watch Page" isn't persistent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31143].
  {panel}

As an admin, it may be necessary to set a user avatar. This could be to remove an inappropriate one, or to set a standard one our org uses. Ideally, this functionality would be exposed via the REST API so user creation can be further automated. 
* Sub feature is to "lock" an avatar and not allow it to be edited by a user.
* Sub feature is to allow editing of multiple user's avatars at once

Current ability to accomplish this happens in one of 2 ways:

1. Use a third party plugin to allow me to SU to a user. Then modify it while logged in as them
2. Change the users password, log in as them, make the change. In the event of an LDAP infrastructure, this means locking them out of multiple systems.
fields.summary: Allow admins to edit user avatars
Confluence page watchers should be notified when a task that is listed in a JIRA Issue macro is updated in JIRA
Don't start Confluence automatically after an upgrade
Not a Recognised Space Error When Creating Anchor Link

fields.description:
After executing the Copy Space plugin, Confluence becomes unstable, the memory usage suddenly increases and is never released.

*More details about the problem:*
* The spaces being copied are quite small (not more than 3KB). 
* After the space is correctly copied, the indexing queue jumps to over 3000 items to reindex. 
* After one hour from the space being copied and having flushed the indexing queue, thousands of items keep being added to the queue.
* We have observed some errors in the logs while the space is being copied (see attached files)
* In some cases apart from the memory usage increase, Confluence is generating a big amount of temp files (~18GB, that is the same size as the total amount of attachments in the instance)
fields.summary: Confluence becomes unstable after using the Copy Space plugin.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31137].
  {panel}

Please could you consider implementing Cache Directory Tagging

http://www.brynosaurus.com/cachedir/

That way when we do a file system level backup we are automatically able to exclude certain cache/temporary index folders.

(I've raised this against confluence, but the request applies to all project.)
fields.summary: Implement Cache Directory Tagging

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a space and select an Integer for the space key
# Create a How-to article for the space. 
# Navigate to the space, and go to How-To articles page.
!one.png|width=500! 
# Try to create a How to article using the *Add How-To Article* button.
 
h4.Actual Results:
The How-To article will not get created. 
!create.png|width=500!
Error in the logs:
{code}
ERROR [http-8090-6] [jersey.spi.container.ContainerResponse] logException Mapped exception to response: 500 (Internal Server Error)
 -- url: /rest/create-dialog/1.0/content-blueprint/create-draft | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8090/display/1/How-To+Articles?src=spaceshortcut
com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.createcontent.exceptions.ResourceException: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Integer cannot be cast to java.lang.String
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.createcontent.rest.ContentBlueprintResource.createDraft(ContentBlueprintResource.java:90)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
	...
	Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Integer cannot be cast to java.lang.String
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.createcontent.api.contextproviders.BlueprintContext.getSpaceKey(BlueprintContext.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence_kb_space_blueprint.ContentTemplateContextProvider.updateBlueprintContext(ContentTemplateContextProvider.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.createcontent.api.contextproviders.AbstractBlueprintContextProvider.getContextMap(AbstractBlueprintContextProvider.java:26)
{code}

h4.Findings:
- It is possible to create How-To article from the top bar {{Create > How-To Article}}.
- This behavior will not be the same if the space key is not an Integer. Articles will be created successfully.
fields.summary: Unable to create How-To articles via create template macro button when space key is an Integer
The ability to 'clear' a table without deleting the columns/rows

fields.description:
h5. Symptoms

When installing Confluence using JIRA as the user directory, it gets stuck at the "Load users and groups from JIRA" screen. The "Next" button is greyed out and can't continue with the installation.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Install Confluence as normal
# When doing the setup wizard on first start, select to use JIRA as the user directory
# Observe the error

h5. Workaround

Since this is only for a fresh install, you can work around it by:

# Stop Confluence
# Remove all data from the database and home directory
# Install Confluence using local users and groups, *not* JIRA
# After installing Confluence, then follow the directions at [Connecting to Crowd or JIRA for User Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/gQ6zDQ]

h5. Alternative workaround

# Right click the "Next" button and go to "Inspect Element"
# Remove the disabled="disabled" section
# The Next button became clickable
fields.summary: Can't use JIRA as a user directory during initial Confluence setup
Cannot update value and change colour of status macro at the same time
Find a better way to display long page titles on the sidebar
Investigate if browser specific fixes that apply to ie9 also affects ie10
Add ability for users to see who is watching the blog in a Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31124].
  {panel}

With the great introduction of sections in Confluence, it would be great to have the PDF have page-breaks before each section.

The current implementation does not seem to have a strategy for page breaks, and I thing using sections is a very good idea.

A possible fallback could be to use headers to have pages not break right after a header, for example.

This would really enhance the possibility to use the PDF:s and not having to save a PDF from the print dialog in Mac.
fields.summary: PDF export layout with page breaks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31123].
  {panel}

When the 'Threaded Comments' option is disabled on Confluence General Configuration, emails are still sent using the same template with the 'Reply' option.
for example:
http://<instance-name>wiki/display/space/page?replyToComment=6324225#comment-6324225

That page will not allow you to add a Reply or Comment.
!reply_no_threads.jpeg|thumbnail!

Removing the '?replyToComment=6324225#comment-6324225' part of the url will display the Add Comment box as expected.
!reply_expected.jpeg|thumbnail!

*How to Reproduce:*
# Disable 'Threaded Comments'
# Comment on a page
# upon reception of the email, click on Reply

*Ideas:*
Since there is no Threads, then the Reply button can be changed to 'Comment' (along with modifying the link) or removed.
fields.summary: Disabling Threaded Comments should permeate to emails also

fields.description:
REF: CONF-29144 - "Directly being linked to an attachment before logging in will redirect to a 'action not permitted' message"

Atlassian Tech support,
       This issue is causing major problems for some of our departments, as a majority of our Wiki documents have PDF attachments. PLEASE escalate this issue to "major" or "critical". this is certainly not a minor issue. Thank you. - Joseph Priolo / PEI-Genesis Corp.  -10/9/2013
fields.summary: REF: CONF-29144 - "Directly being linked to an attachment before logging in will redirect to a 'action not permitted' message"
Need Bold Colors in Highlight Table Selection in Pages
Restrict some users or groups so they can't see all other confluence users.

fields.description:
Here are the step to reproduce the issue: 
# Create a new page with either "html-include" macro or "blog-post" macro. 
# Save the page. 
# In the page searching run the JQL "nameMacro:blog-post" or "nameMacro:html-include", the search will return nothing. 
# When using the JQL "nameMacro:blog-post*" or "nameMacro:html-include*" will return the related page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31117].
  {panel}

Is it possible to add a drop down list to the *Insert Link* dialog box that allows the user to define whether a link opens:
* On the Current Page (default)
* In a New Tab
* In a New Window

There are many requests for this type of functionality on the Atlassian sites and, even though this feature can be realized by implementing User Macros, it would be nice to have it as a built-in feature for On Demand and On Premises versions of Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence Hyperlink Opens in a New Tab or a New Window

fields.description:
Hello,

We have been working with your support team for the last 6+ months on our upgrade from release 2.5.2.  I wanted to notify you that we are scheduled to migrate to production the week of October 14th.  Our go live date is October 18th.  

Please be aware that if we enter a support ticket during this time it could be a critical issue that will need immediate attention.  

Your support team has been great during this process so I don't anticipate any issue but just in case!  

Thanks!
Diane
fields.summary: Go Live Schedule

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31115].
  {panel}

I'd like users to be able to create a list of reserved labels that only they can use to tag/label content within the system. This will create predictability and ensure that undesired content doesn't sneak into critical pages.

*Use case:*
Create dynamic pages leveraging labels, but give control to users over what content is aggregated to the page eliminating worry about whether someone else might use their labels on other pages.

It's simple enough to create a monstrosity of a label which is less likely to be used by others, but you still run the risk of rogue content sneaking in if another user uses that label on one of their pages unbeknownst to the user who created the content.

Having reserved labels also creates predictability when using labels in other applications/addons or programmatically.
fields.summary: Reserved Labels

fields.description:
Confluence 5.3 is  using Widget Connector Plugin 
2.1.7 but in [marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.widgetconnector] it does not include Confluence 5.3 as a compatible version.

fields.description:
After remove of some Page History Pages (analog [Page History and Page Comparison Views|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/cyAC]) our comparision won't work correct anymore.

h3. Why is this Important to us?
* If you do work on a page you will change and save, change and save. If you are ready you will finally save and notify.
* But your working copies aren't interesting for your collegues so you will remove them.

Looking at the screenshot
!NotWorkingComparision.PNG!
you see:
* v.19 Wolfgang
* v.20 Claus (Current) - Current Version has been v.30 - but I deleted the other ones
If I do a comparision between v.20 and v.19 I see only the change I did between former v.30 and v.29 which was minimal.

After that I changed again only a small thing so version v.21 was created.
If I do it like
!WorkingComparision_onlyMinimalChange.PNG!
and Compare Version v.21 and v.19 I get correctly shown any changes I did between v.19 and v.21

h3. Reproduce
I am not able to reproduce this using a single User on same day using another page. Maybe a day in between is needed or I need another user for this.
Or maybe it depends which order I used to delete it.
I tried to do a reindex 

* Create a Page containing One Line {{Line 1}} and Save to close Create
* Edit page, add one Line {{Line 2}} and Save to close Edit
* Edit page, add one Line {{Line 3}} and Save to close Edit
Now you have A History of v.1 v.2 and v.3 (Current)
If you compare Version v.1 and v.3 you get a green mark of {{Line 1}} and {{Line 2}}
If you delete Page v.2 and do a new comparision between v.1 and new v.2 it works.
But I won't get it work for this page.
fields.summary: Page History comparision shows too less changes

fields.description:
Until version 5.1 the autocomplete/autosuggest function in the searchbox in the top bar worked perfectly. 

E.g. someone searched for the document (attachment) "VL_Investitionsantrag_V2.0.pdf" and started to type "inve" then it automatically showed up the attachment and you could directly go to the attachment page.

Now it doesn't work anymore and you have to type "vl_inve" to get the result.
Please see screenshots.

Our users are very unhappy with this development. Please help us to fix this problem.

Thank you in advance!
fields.summary: Search Autocomplete

fields.description:
We have Confluence pages that we have the widget connectors that are associated with youtube training videos (they happen to be all Atlassian videos). 

In Safari, they display just fine.  But, in FF and Chrome, the pages now display blank.  When you edit the page, you can see that they are there, but when you edit the gadget itself, the youtube video doesn't even preview. 

I've attached examples of what it looks like in FF, Chrome, and Safari. 

Edit:  This is happening because of updates to Chrome and Firefox where mixed content (http & https URLs) are blocked by default.  

*Workaround*: To unblock this content, if you would like, click on the security shield icon in the right of the address bar in Chrome, and the left address bar in Firefox.
fields.summary: Youtube gadget content is not displaying in FF, Chrome
Add labels to autocomplete / quicknav in search box

fields.description:
If you search something, then after that, edit the search criteria in the left panel, nothing changes. This happens for all users and all browsers. 

*Diagnosis*
 It seems that the behavior can be reproduced in the following cases : 
The problem can be reproduced on a fresh install under either of these conditions:
* The Workbox plugins are disabled:
** Workbox - Common Plugin
** Workbox - Confluence Provider Plugin
** Workbox - Host Plugin
* OR, if Confluence Admin > In-app Notifications is disabled
fields.summary: Search filtering does not work if Workbox plugin or in-app notifications are disabled
Drag-drop to upload attachment should prompt for confirmation
